profession.12.name: Forester
profession.12.detail: Trees drop 25% more wood. Additional +{{bonus}} Trees, +{{bonus1}} seeds, and tree grows faster per forage level
profession.13.name: Gatherer
profession.13.detail: Chance for double harvest of foraged items. Additional +{{bonus}} foraged item per each forage level
profession.14.name: Lumberjack
profession.14.detail: All trees have a chance to drop hardwood. Even more chances for hardwood drops and faster tree growth, both scales with forage level.
profession.15.name: Tapper
profession.15.detail: Syrups worth 25% more. +{{bonus}} faster tapping, +{{bonus1}} syrup per forage level.
profession.16.name: Botanist
profession.16.detail: Foraged items are always highest quality. Additional +25% more Foraged items when foraging
profession.17.name: Tracker
profession.17.detail: Location of forgeable items revealed. Additional +50% more Foraged items when foraging
profession.18.name: Miner
profession.19.name: Geologist
profession.20.name: Blacksmith
profession.20.desc:
Metal bars worth 50% more.
New crafting recipe: QuickSmelt
Smelt ores into bars instantly but cost more resource
profession.21.name: Prospector
profession.21.desc: Chance to find Coal doubled. +{{bonus}} extra coal drops per mining level. +1% nodes are coal Nodes or Clay Nodes
profession.22.name: Excavator
profession.22.desc:
Chance to find geodes doubled. +{{bonus}} additional node drop per mining level.
+1% nodes are Geode Nodes
profession.23.name: Gemologist
profession.23.desc:
Gems Worth 30% more.
+1% nodes are gem nodes
gmcm.section.editSkills.title: Edit Skill Settings
gmcm.section.editSkills.desc: Click on one of the Skill pages below to modify the drops without professions and the drop bonuses from a professions based on the skill level.
gmcm.section.other.title: Other Settings
gmcm.section.other.desc: Click on one of the other pages below to turn off entire function or some functions in this mod so that it can continue to work with other mods
gmcm.page.other.title: Other Settings
gmcm.page.other.paragraph: If your having issues with this mod working with other mods, feel free to adjust the general setting features below to turn off certain functions in this mod so that you may use other mods that may share the same code they are being overwritten (Harmony Patch).
gmcm.option.enableMod.name: Mine For More Enabled
gmcm.option.enableMod.tooltip: Disables all functions from this mod except the config menu, allowing you to re-enable it later. Requires restarting the game.
gmcm.option.mineDay1.name: User Can Mine on Day 1
gmcm.option.mineDay1.tooltip: Allows mine access on Day 1. Turning this off will prevent mine access before Day 5.
gmcm.option.overLevel10.name: Skill Levels Can Exceed 10
gmcm.option.overLevel10.tooltip: Allows skills to exceed level 10. Requires restarting the game. Disabling this will remove the Harmony patch on Farmer.ExperienceGain. This setting doesn't affect current EXP, it prevents further EXP gain beyond level 10.
gmcm.option.levelUpDesc.name: Allow Updated Level Up Descriptions
gmcm.option.levelUpDesc.tooltip: Enables a Harmony patch to show more accurate profession descriptions during level-up. Turning this off will revert to vanilla descriptions. Requires game restart to apply
gmcm.option.extraNodes.name: Allow Extra Node Spawns
gmcm.option.extraNodes.tooltip: Enables extra node spawns in the mines, based on both base chance and profession bonuses. Requires a game restart to take effect.
gmcm.option.DebugMode.name: Debug Mode
gmcm.option.DebugMode.tooltip: Print logging to console for debugging
gmcm.page.foraging.title: Foraging Settings
gmcm.page.foraging.prof.title: Foraging Profession Bonuses
gmcm.page.foraging.prof.tooltip:
These settings apply Foraging drop bonuses and multipliers based on your professions.
Formula: Final Drop = (Base Drop + Bonus from Profession) × Multiplier
gmcm.page.foraging.prof.paragraph: Update the bonus drops obtained from a profession. Adjust the drop per skill level below to adjust how much bonus drops you get if you have learned the listed profession.
gmcm.foraging.option.woodPerLevel.name: Extra Wood Per Foraging Level
gmcm.foraging.option.woodPerLevel.toolti: How much extra wood to grant per Foraging level if the player has the Forester profession.
Tree Growth Rate Bonus Per Level
How much faster trees grow per Foraging level with the Forester profession.
gmcm.foraging.option.seedPerLevel.name: Tree Seed Bonus Per Level
gmcm.foraging.option.seedPerLevel.toolti: How much Seed drops per Foraging level with the Forester profession.
gmcm.foraging.option.hardwoodChancePerLe: Chance to drop hardwood from any tree per Foraging level if you have the Lumberjack profession. Value is a percentage (e.g., 0.5 = 50%).
gmcm.foraging.option.hardwoodDropChanceP: Chance per Foraging level to trigger a hardwood drop when cutting down any tree (e.g., 0.025 = 2.5% per level).
gmcm.page.foraging.chop.paragraph: Update the drops obtained without requiring a profession. These adjust works right away and is added with the profession bonuses before the added values are multiplied with the multiplier below.
gmcm.page.foraging.foraged.paragraph: Update the drops obtained without requiring a profession. These adjust works right away and is added with the profession bonuses before the added values are multiplied with the multiplier below.
gmcm.foraging.option.gathererExtraPerLev: How many extra items per Foraging level when the player has the Gatherer profession.
gmcm.foraging.option.tapperSpeedPerLevel: If farmer has Tapper Profession then speed it takes for tapper to get syrup is sped up by this value per each Foraging level. Example If this value is set at 0.25 at Level 10 Forage would = 2.5× faster speed on top of original speed. Tapper speed or heavy tapper speed is applied first, then this bonus tapper speed is applied after.
gmcm.foraging.option.tapperExtraQuantity: Additional syrup units granted per Foraging level (additive). Example: 1.0 at level 5 adds +5 to the batch size.
gmcm.page.mining.title: Mining Settings
gmcm.page.mining.prof.title: Mining Profession Bonuses
gmcm.page.mining.prof.tooltip:
These settings apply mining drop bonuses and multipliers based on your professions.
Formula: Final Drop = (Base Drop + Bonus from Profession) × Multiplier
gmcm.page.mining.prof.paragraph: Update the bonus drops obtained from a profession. Adjust the drop per skill level below to adjust how much bonus drops you get if you have learned the listed profession.
gmcm.mining.option.minerOre.name: Miner Bonus (Ore)
gmcm.mining.option.minerOre.tooltip: Bonus ore amount per each mining level if you have the Miner profession.
gmcm.mining.option.geologistGem.name: Geologist Bonus (Gem)
gmcm.mining.option.geologistGem.tooltip: Bonus number of gems dropped per mining level when you have the Geologist profession.
gmcm.mining.option.gemologistNode.name: Gemologist Bonus (Gem Node)
gmcm.mining.option.gemologistNode.toolti: Bonus gem node spawn chance (%) if you have the Gemologist profession.
gmcm.mining.option.prospectorCoal.name: Prospector Bonus (Coal)
gmcm.mining.option.prospectorCoal.toolti: Bonus coal per each mining level if you have the Prospector profession.
gmcm.mining.option.prospectorCoalNode.to: Bonus coal node spawn chance (%) if you have the Prospector profession.
gmcm.mining.option.excavatorGeode.name: Excavator Bonus (Geode)
gmcm.mining.option.excavatorGeode.toolti: Bonus geodes per each mining level if you have the Excavator profession.
gmcm.mining.option.excavatorGeodeNode.to: Bonus geode node spawn chance (%) if you have the Excavator profession.
gmcm.page.mining.drops.title: Mining - Configure Drops
gmcm.page.mining.drops.tooltip: These settings applies mining drop and multiplier that works with the extra drops from profession. Formula is Ore Drop = (DropCountFromBelow + BonusFromProfession) * MultipierFromBelow
gmcm.page.mining.drops.paragraph: Update the drops obtained from without requiring a profession. These adjust works right away without profession, and is added with the profession bonuses.
gmcm.drop.addAmount.name: {{label}} - AddAmount
gmcm.drop.multiplier.name: {{label}} - Multiplier
gmcm.drop.multiplier.tooltip: Multiplier to apply to {{label}}'s total drop count.
gmcm.drop.extraNodeChance.name: {{label}} - Extra Node Chance (%)
gmcm.drop.extraNodeChance.tooltip: Chance that an extra {{label}} node appears in the mine (no profession required).
